wikipedia_page.main: Herschel Lewis Austin (22 March 1911 – 8 April 1974) was a British Labour Party politician who served as the Member of Parliament (MP) for Stretford from 1945 to 1950.

response: Two of Stretford's famous residents were the suffragette Emmeline Pankhurst and the painter L. S. Lowry, who was born in Stretford in 1887. Manchester's first multi-millionaire John Rylands and his wife Enriqueta Augustina Rylands lived at Longford Hall in Stretford during the later parts of their lives. The radical firebrand socialist, and later post-war politician Herschel Lewis Austin (1911–1974) served Stretford as a Labour Member of Parliament between 1945 and 1950.
